pillar: I am finding it hard to seek mental health support

questions.preMessage: Taking the first step towards seeking mental health support is often the hardest. Let's explore what's holding you back.
questions.text: What main factors make it hard for you to seek mental health support?

options.text: Stigma or fear of judgment
Lack of information or awareness
Financial constraints
Uncertainty about where to start

questions.preMessage: Stigma and fear of judgment can be significant barriers. Acknowledging this is a vital step forward.
questions.text: How does stigma or fear of judgment affect your willingness to seek help?

options.text: Concerned about others' opinions
Worried about professional repercussions
Feeling ashamed or embarrassed
Fear of being misunderstood

questions.preMessage: A lack of information can make the journey to mental health support seem daunting. Identifying your needs can help guide you.
questions.text: What kind of information do you feel is lacking in your search for support?

options.text: Understanding different types of mental health issues
Knowing what kind of help is available
Finding reliable and trustworthy resources
Information on how to access services

questions.preMessage: Financial constraints should not be a barrier to mental health support. Understanding your options can open new doors.
questions.text: How do financial constraints impact your ability to seek mental health support?

options.text: Cannot afford private therapy or counseling
Lack of insurance coverage
High cost of medication or treatment
Unsure about cost-effective options

questions.preMessage: Starting the process of seeking mental health support is a significant step. Clarifying your uncertainties can help ease the journey.

options.text: Not sure how to find the right therapist or counselor
